flixel.util.FlxGradient

type
class
Adds a set of color gradient creation / rendering functions

Static Methods

createGradientArray(width : Int, height : Int, colors : Array<Int>, ?chunkSize : Int, ?rotation : Int, ?interpolate : Bool) : Array<Int>

createGradientBitmapData(width : Int, height : Int, colors : Array<Int>, ?chunkSize : Int, ?rotation : Int, ?interpolate : Bool) : flash.display.BitmapData

createGradientFlxSprite(width : Int, height : Int, colors : Array<Int>, ?chunkSize : Int, ?rotation : Int, ?interpolate : Bool) : flixel.FlxSprite

parameters
width The width of the FlxSprite (and therefore gradient)
height The height of the FlxSprite (and therefore gradient)
colors An array of colour values for the gradient to cycle through
chunkSize If you want a more old-skool looking chunky gradient, increase this value!
rotation Angle of the gradient in degrees. 90 = top to bottom, 180 = left to right. Any angle is valid
interpolate Interpolate the colours? True uses RGB interpolation, false uses linear RGB
returns
An FlxSprite containing your gradient (if valid parameters given!)
Creates an FlxSprite of the given width/height with a colour gradient flowing through it.

createGradientMatrix(width : Int, height : Int, colors : Array<Int>, ?chunkSize : Int, ?rotation : Int) : GradientMatrix

overlayGradientOnBitmapData(dest : flash.display.BitmapData, width : Int, height : Int, colors : Array<Int>, ?destX : Int, ?destY : Int, ?chunkSize : Int, ?rotation : Int, ?interpolate : Bool) : flash.display.BitmapData

parameters
dest The BitmapData to overlay the gradient onto
width The width of the FlxSprite (and therefore gradient)
height The height of the FlxSprite (and therefore gradient)
colors An array of colour values for the gradient to cycle through
destX The X offset the gradient is drawn at (default 0)
destY The Y offset the gradient is drawn at (default 0)
chunkSize If you want a more old-skool looking chunky gradient, increase this value!
rotation Angle of the gradient in degrees. 90 = top to bottom, 180 = left to right. Any angle is valid
interpolate Interpolate the colours? True uses RGB interpolation, false uses linear RGB
returns
The composited BitmapData
Creates a new gradient and overlays that on-top of the given BitmapData at the destX/destY coordinates (default 0,0)
Use low alpha values in the colours to have the gradient overlay and not destroy the image below

overlayGradientOnFlxSprite(dest : flixel.FlxSprite, width : Int, height : Int, colors : Array<Int>, ?destX : Int, ?destY : Int, ?chunkSize : Int, ?rotation : Int, ?interpolate : Bool) : flixel.FlxSprite

parameters
dest The FlxSprite to overlay the gradient onto
width The width of the FlxSprite (and therefore gradient)
height The height of the FlxSprite (and therefore gradient)
colors An array of colour values for the gradient to cycle through
destX The X offset the gradient is drawn at (default 0)
destY The Y offset the gradient is drawn at (default 0)
chunkSize If you want a more old-skool looking chunky gradient, increase this value!
rotation Angle of the gradient in degrees. 90 = top to bottom, 180 = left to right. Any angle is valid
interpolate Interpolate the colours? True uses RGB interpolation, false uses linear RGB
returns
The composited FlxSprite (for chaining, if you need)
Creates a new gradient and overlays that on-top of the given FlxSprite at the destX/destY coordinates (default 0,0)
Use low alpha values in the colours to have the gradient overlay and not destroy the image below
